bibl.title: Dietary Hellenization or Ecological Transformation? Beer, Wine and Oil in Later Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: Expanded version of the paper read at the congress. - Introduction. - The case for and against dietary hellenization: beer. - The case for and against hellenization: wheat. - The interplay of beer, wine and wheat. - The interplay between the various types of oil and wheat. - The third century and after. - Concluding remarks.

bibl.title: Atti del XXII Congresso Internazionale di Papirologia. Firenze, 23-29 agosto 1998. Volume II

bibl.seg: VAN MINNEN Peter, Dietary Hellenization or Ecological Transformation? Beer, Wine and Oil in Later Roman Egypt.

Isabella ANDORLINI, Guido BASTIANINI, Manfredo MANFREDI e Giovanna MENCI (a cura di), Atti del XXII Congresso Internazionale di Papirologia. Firenze, 23-29 agosto 1998. Volume II (Firenze, 2001) pp. 1265-1280.

Expanded version of the paper read at the congress. - Introduction. - The case for and against dietary hellenization: beer. - The case for and against hellenization: wheat. - The interplay of beer, wine and wheat. - The interplay between the various types of oil and wheat. - The third century and after. - Concluding remarks.
